issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Wahram I on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown cap with rays; covered korymbos; upper ribbons pointing upwards; plain diadem, diadem ribbons commencing above ball of hair; cheek flaps; tunica, neck-line edged with pearl row; dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o. mzdysn bgy wrhr'n MRKAn MRKA 'yr'n W 'nyr'n MNW ctry MN yzd'n| mazdēsn bay Wahrām šāhān šāh Ērān ud Anērān kē čihr az yazdān|"The Mazda-worshiping divine Wahram, King of Kings of the Iranians and non-Iranians, whose seeds/splendour is from the gods; star in right field
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; square altar shaft; two altar slabs; altar flames depicted with parallel strokes; to the left and right of the altar attendant with stylized mural crown with korymbos, holding barsom with both hands, both facing inwards, dotted border
